He explained quickly and got right to the orders. For drinks all of us got the Capri-sun drink(not the actual name). I was tasty, can definitely taste the alcohol, which we all liked. We started with 4 different meats to start and they came out fairly quickly. Server turn on the bbq and we went at it. Overall the meats were delicious we tried literally about everything. Top fave crispy fried Korean chicken and sirloin steak. We were thrown off in the beginning but the food and speed saved it. My friends and I will definitely be back. $27 bucks for all you can eat meat!! You really can't beat that unless you were an all you can eat buffet.   If their is one thing I would say is servers should engage more with the guest. Give name, ask if this is the first time, just give the experience. Of course the food is what we came for and that we're basically doing everything ourselves but engage me. Tell me what meats are good. What we should try, thing to try with the meats with. Specially if you want to help your tip.

dCS-Q8ZxAXftn4yQkgh7ow.text: The California locations seem to pay much more attention to the quality of meat. The bulgogi at this location is so fatty, I had to stop ordering it after the third try. The beef tongue was delicious, and so are the gyoza and salad. Overall quality of meat is not worth the price

Ev9svLBahIxl59ORR9mW5w.text: One of my favorite chain KBBQ places, glad I don't have to go to Cali anymore to fill the void.  As usual, always a great experience with selection, service and pricing.  Not even that long of a wait during rush!

cX2uwK86YnMLKP5Qs66lSw.text: This Korean bbq restaurant is located in the heart of Tempe marketplace. The place usually has a +40 minute wait to be seated, so if that doesn't tell you how popular this place is I don't know what will. The ambiance is wonderful, neon blue lights decorating the interior. The food, which is the main character in this review, was absolutely delicious. Gen really knows how to offer you unique foods that I have not had at other Korean bbq places in the valley. The one thing I do have a bone to pick about is the portion sizes. Oh Ya in Phoenix, AZ definitely gives bigger portions...   Other wise, great service and great food!

_DJN81blw9xrtY7jeeLR5g.text: I have came in around 11 this morning and was represented with excellent customer service by #AP (Amanda). She was super friendly, nice, and had a can do spirit. It has made me feel well assured that I was in the right environment, and that I was appreciated as a well valued customer. I will be back to this business because of Amanda's amazing customer service.

pEb8-tRXuDxY6w94-GmwEQ.text: There's always room for improvement (in most cases). I'll start out with that. This place has a loud smoky atmosphere. (Better ventilation?) I like the white leather seating and blue lighting throughout the place. One thing that I would highly critique that may be a little bit nitpicking but with the dirty dishes being put maybe in the corner of the restaurant or somewhere else besides around 3 or 4 different tables and one of the wait staff kept dropping plates and was really loud; therefore if it wasn't near three or four different tables it wouldn't sound as obnoxious when someone keeps dropping plates like that.  Food. 30 something meats to choose from with a few items to order to be brought out already cooked and ready to eat. Great seasoned meats.   I would definitely recommend the place as it is a cute date spot whether it be lunch or dinner. The hostess needs to change her attitude; she acts as if her parents own the place and she is just a hostess and has no relation to the owners. If the owners or management reads this I think they know exactly the lady who I speak of and that needs to be corrected. Definitely unprofessional.

siponxCENpAT_GqzcXdWBg.text: I'm a little surprised I haven't written a review here yet since I go so often. I'll preface with the fact that the long 3 hours waits are gone so if you haven't been in awhile you don't have to fear about that anymore. I'll just write about my most recent visit which was only like a week ago. The only reason I didn't give the fifth star was because some friends of mine had got zero degrees down the way and were told to toss their drinks or take them to their cars because they don't allow outside food and drinks. Which I mean rules are rules but wouldn't you want people to fill up to eat less? Whatever not the end of the world for me. We had a larger group and it's usually 4 plates i believe at a time but our server Phillip was attentive and was on top of our group so we basically never had an empty grill or sides. That's pretty much the whole idea of AYCEKBBQ so the the review is basically for Phillip and myself since I was the main cook for our group so kudos to us. The location is tempe market place so I always tell my friends to park behind the kabuki/gen area or waste time in the front trying to fight for a spot. Also if you're a newbie to Gen remember to ask for extra green tea salt to season your premium steaks. Thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Soondubo
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jap chae
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy baby octopus

FjAY5ElX6uKDAjlMfNz-hw.text: Crowded place on the weekends but overall very friendly workers there, nice environment. Don't go with your nicest clothes tho because the smell of the smoke will stick to it

GItCOhjtnuo8uNisjRxHng.text: My boyfriend, a meat lover, suggested we try this place at Tempe Marketplace. Although I'm not much of a meat eater, it looked trendy and fun with good reviews, so I was good to go. We ended up waiting about 40 mins for a table on a fairly busy Sunday night.  Before you order, they will explain the very specific rules to you - set price per person ($24.99), four orders at a time, grill most things yourself, and don't leave leftovers unless you want to be charged. I was kind of put off by the last part... charged, for leftovers? But my boyfriend explained that it's more like a buffet, so if you order and don't eat it, they consider it wasted food (you can't take anything home). That being said, definitely take a few minutes between courses so you don't get charged unnecessarily.  On to the food: my favorites were the Hawaiian Steak, Gyoza dumplings, fried chicken, and the salad. His favorite was the Galbi, which is marinated bone-in short rib and available for dinner only. Since it's unlimited, portions are small, so you can order more of what you like and try as many things as possible. Even though I'm not big into meat, I still enjoyed trying most of the options. The meat is tender and marinated nicely. And since it's raw it comes out very quickly after ordered.  Finally, they offer ice cream sandwich desserts in green tea and fruity flavors - they were small and good! A nice ending to a substantial dinner.  Overall, this is a pretty cool place if this style of all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ is what you're looking for. It may not be exactly my thing, but I would come back again for a special occasion.

K_HIAFg7iNtnjAbYXq2cjg.text: Worth the price. Fun atmosphere with decent food. Nothing bad to say about the place. I'd recommend it anyone. Two hour time limit for the meal which is plenty of time. The service is speedy too.

_YwZTqtpH-jIm_qbR1ZIrQ.text: New all you can eat Korean BBQ and the food was amazing! The restaurant is so spacious and much bigger then I thought it would be. It's located right next to Kabuki and across from Barnes and Nobles. I came here on a Tuesday night and our wait was 45 minutes. They do not take reservations so don't bother calling and just expect to wait about an hour to eat. You can shop to kill time and they will text you when your table is ready.  All you can eat for $25 with a maximum of 2 hours. They offer a variety of meats and side dishes ( salads, pickled onions, potato salad, spicy cucumber, radish and kimchi etc) You can order up to four meats at a time and order more as you go. The side dishes were on the small side but you can ask for more so it wasn't a big deal.   Our server was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.

J2bk5oE28tKIUDKdoANKmw.text: Back like I never left...  GEN?? Thats what me and the boys ask each other when we're in the mood to stuff our faces. Come hungry and leave slowly (cause you'll be wobbling out like a piggy)  All you can eat, lunch is 15.99 and dinner is 24.99 (Some stuff isnt included in lunch such as beef tongue and iron steaks). Rice is included in both.  Some waiters are cool and understand me and the boys like to keep the food coming, so they let you put in as many orders as you want. Some are more 'by the books' and limit you to four orders at a time. It's their loss because they'll be running around more. LOL  Only downside to the place is the service isn't amazing. The busboys are on point, but the waiters are okay. Me and the boys are always breaking our necks trying to find a waiter and they're all running around like chickens without a head. They probably need more staff on the floor. And the brisket always takes a while to come out for whatever reason.  But place is great. Me and the boys' personal record is 56 plates and counting between 4 people. We were told thats the #1 record right now and I got the receipt to prove it, so if you up for the challenge hit me up!!  -X  Edit:  Jan D a horrible server. I came with a party of 7 and this guy just couldn't get the orders straight. Half the orders we placed literally never came out at all. Isolated incident because I've been here over 10 times and this never happened.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. 56 plates between 4 people, a new record, can you beat this??

FoM8bmKqu-I3vJEcFMi8ZQ.text: The staff totally made the experience at this BBQ house. Often if you try to visit a Korean BBQ spot the food takes a little while to come out, drinks aren't refilled as frequently etc.   Not the case here!  Their staff was on point just as much as their food. From the moment we sat down until the moment we left we were constantly checked in on, brought refills, etc. they even provided excellent suggestions based on what we shared we enjoyed off the menu.   You can't go wrong making this a night out. For first timers it is an all you can eat deal for $25 per person. But they aren't kidding when they say you get all you can eat. Whatever you want to try they will bring you. We didn't shy from the beef tongue or intestines.  Tongue was a much easier texture for me. My very favorite was (no surprise) the pork bulgogi.   Fun. Yummy. Great service.

vIO8wnCgtuTp-bI7tF_xgg.text: This place used to be the best in the city. Now the quality has changed very badly. Service is terrible and meat is very low quality. Even the macaroon ice creams got smaller in size. Now have to look for a new place to go.

x3cXH8bzB2BScGkc9O0D9w.text: I eat Korean bbq almost every weekend and been here at least 10+ times. The food is okay, but it's unlimited so it has its perks. They are always firing and hiring new people, everything is unorganized, and people look like they are running around with their heads chopped off. I have had 2 great experiences where the food was fast, the staff was attentive and great but unfortunately we have had more poor experiences than food. I couldn't even post a picture because the light was broken above our table.

9I-ypkgE1wu2-P4njGLtMg.text: Really liked the ambiance, the service was amazing! The food was very good. I just wish they had kpop playing on the background. That would be fun to listen to!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

L8U5qE3l-raqklKKhfb99w.text: Nine of us came here to celebrate my wife's birthday. When my mother-in-law called, they told her that they don't take reservations, but when we got there they said they had two large parties already scheduled for that night, so I'm still not clear as to whether they actually would have accepted a reservation if they had known the size of our group.  Because we didn't have a reservation they told us it would be an hour wait if we wanted to be split into two tables or a two hour wait to sit as one group at the high top tables. We opted for the hour wait and agreed to split into two groups. After nearly an hour had passed, and watching the Yelp app showing that we were nearly next on the list, we checked on our table. At that point they started to claim that it would be another hour before we could get in. It appeared that they were trying to wait for two tables to clear at the same time, rather than hold one open until a second one cleared. As a result, it seemed to me that other people were being sat before us. We almost left, but decided to give it a few more minutes. I don't know if they could that we were going to leave, but within 20 minutes we were notified that our tables were ready, although it still took another 10 minutes before we were actually seated. So, nearly 90 minutes after arriving we were finally ready to begin ordering.  The concept itself is fairly straightforward. There's a burner/hotplate/grill in the middle of the table, you order from the menu of 38 items, cook the items you order on the grill, and eat. The cost is $25 per person and it is all-you-can-eat. To ensure that you're eyes aren't bigger than your stomach, they will only allow you to order 4 items at a time, there is a two-hour time limit on how long you can stay at a table, and they charge you $5 for any items not eaten (basically a restocking charge).  As for the food, there are many options and it's fun to try new things. Among the more common items we tried were the garlic chicken, Korean Fried Chicken, pork belly, and calamari. The more exotic items included baby octopus, shrimp (with heads and tails still attached), and beef tongue. The expressions on my kids face were priceless as they put an octopus on the grill or learned to devein a shrimp, but they soldiered on actually really liked the food. My 12-year-old said his favorite was the spiced pork bulgogi while I enjoyed the beef tongue the best, although it was sliced so thin it didn't really have the typical tongue flavor.  Food service was fast although my one complaint was that every time you asked for a refill on your drink they took the entire glass and actually refilled and returned it which took a while. Come on, plastic glasses aren't that pricey and a restaurant should have enough so that your server can get you a new soda and remove your old one at the same time.  Also, they should really take reservations as they almost lost our entire business and we likely won't ever return because of the wait. Once we were in though, we did enjoy the food and the experience so if you don't mind waiting or just want to plan to do some shopping at Tempe Marketplace first, you may want to check it out.

d9LJgqVxrQY0TSKXCqnkZg.text: This is an excellent Korean barbecue place. We can eat, of course. Very extensive menu and tasty, good quality ingredients. Instead of the traditional rice paper side dish, they have Finley sliced pickled radish disks, which serve the same purpose but are healthier.   The food was excellent. The place looks great too, except the bar area looks like an out-of-place afterthought. Definitely not a cool place to lounge if you're just looking to have some cocktails. This is definitely somewhere you go if you are hungry.

9Hd8NYrgznoMyfpX-doldg.text: The 1 star isn't because of the staff or service but because the food quality and quantity was not there. I've been to several Korean BBQ places and this was far from comparison. They give you veeeery small portions for $24.99 which is their dinner AYCE (all you can eat). I took my girlfriend and niece who was visiting from CA and it cost $75 minus the drinks and tip. You would think with such high price the quality of the meat would be outstanding but in fact was not satisfying. In CA, I can find several kbbq at $11.99 AYCE or for the more expensive package not more than $17 $18. I understand we aren't in CA but this is why to me, my girlfriend and niece, is not worth spending your money at.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Definitely not worth what they are charging
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

urHlQbus7aI6Z3bfyh3R1w.text: Finally got to come here with the fam and friends.  All you can eat Korean BBQ!!!  Meat lovers paradise.  The location was clean, well kept, well designed and plenty of seating.  The staffs were friendly, kind, helpful and quite attentive.    The quality of the food was quite decent, the meats come out quite fast so it's not long till the cookin' starts!  You can't take anything home, and if you waste food they charge you extra, so try not to let your eyes do the talking, which can be quite hard.  We tried a few steaks, short ribs, pork bellies, octopus and squids, jaws, claws and whatever we could get.  All were quite tasty.  I ate so much meats I was oily for the next few days.    The loo was quite clean and well kept.  Had to do a two to make room for the short ribs.  Well worth it.  The flush is slightly more powerful then the common house toilet.  Good loo, a decent loo, don't see why anyone should not use it to make more capacity so they can eat more.    Overall a great place with decent food, don't see why we wouldn't come back!  So go here and get your meats don't worry about rice or the sides on the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mmmmm

t2slSYyHX5VIO7QfCeRyKA.text: So if you're a carnivore looking to go into a meat coma, this is the spot for you! Let me tell you this place is absolutely delicious! So many great meats to choose from and you get two hours to eat at your hearts desire!  Came here on a Saturday night with a friend and was told it would be a 45 min wait. That's ok, it's in a mall with lots of things to do. Plan ahead and be prepared to wait a bit during their peak hours. They'll text you when your table is ready. The ambiance of this place is very hip, almost felt kind of like a night club.  Once you're seated you'll have a menu of meats to choose from that you can order in increments of 4 at a time.  If you order a plate and don't eat it, then it's a five dollar charge per plate! Make sure to eat it all and also order the next round of meats before your previous order is fully eaten to optimize the cadence of the meat train! My favorite dishes were the spicy pork belly, beef bulgogi, and the octopus!  Went into a meat coma way before the two hours was up! Will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

zjwT23TLytmobq1XVHxUpA.text: Okay, i have never been to a Korean BBQ place so I have zero baseline, but I thought this place was phenomenal! The food tasted great, the large bar top accommodated my large party of 12 and it was clean. We had so much fun and I'll definitely be back.

iADiVKAi6fH6sq3V9a-3Mw.text: I have come through here multiple times and I usually enjoy it. Their menu whether it is lunch or dinner has quite a list of options. One of my favorites has to be the Korean Fried Chicken. Their service is usually pretty good, however, when it is busy it is a little harder/longer to get help which is understandable. When ordering or asking for things, they usually are bringing it out or doing it promptly. I would recommend trying this place out their prices are a little better than some other places.

rieHCVwUlPLAVjXhzp2T1w.text: I cant believe I did not leave a review for this place yet. I have had plenty of Korean BBQ, but this place is up there as being one of my favorites. The environment is very hip and modern, typically ment for teenagers and young adults to hang out at. The price is very reasonable and they have plenty of options to choose from, and they also have plenty of staff to tend to your needs, so we dont have to wait like 40 minutes to change our grill(amazzzinnggg).  I always go when my friends come to Arizona! Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

WPUF6OGaNY4DDA50LGDh-g.text: We went on a Sunday at noon. No wait. No issues. You walk right in to a table with snack side dishes already there, which was great, because we were STARVING! Our waitress was friendly and fabulous. Our orders and reorders came super fast.    All these review about strict rules and stuff had me all paranoid. There were no issues. They took dishes away that had stuff still on them, took a soup that was half eaten when we were finished. No extra charges. Just order the 4 at a time and you'll be fine. Also, we did do SOME half portions when only one person wanted a certain item. That helped. I think the two of us tried about 16 items. Totally great. I'm hooked!  The food and atmosphere were both stellar. I'd eat here everyday if I lived closer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Soft Tofu Soup. Soubds odd. Tastes KILLER!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. First meat and veggies in! Woooo!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Side dishes waiting when we got sat, hot grill ready to go!

U8WjYPG2Ka6Avp2ABcD3eg.text: Today marked my 2nd visit to GEN.  A fabulous experience overall, and thanks too, Ian for the friendly, competent service!  This place is always "poppin'", full of college kids, upper class socialites, and generally saavy "fellow foodies" who are "in the know"  My glowing review is a bit of an amalgamation of both visits.  Meats are of good quality, not the heaviest of deep spiced marinades like i prefer, but a balance of all things good that should please most palates. The 2 seasoning salts too will quell any overly sweet marinades like on the galbi (use them, a pinch adds punch).  Cheese corn seems to be a "thing" here in the local Az market, and of the 2 places where i've tried it, you guys get a slight edge, and i like selecting how long to leave on the heat.  Where i hail from - we're the land of dolsot bibimbap and soondubu paired with AYCE meats.  I would welcome some stone pot kimchi fried rice!and  Today, in addition to my usual samplings of all varieties of pork belly, chadol, etc, i tried a breaded pork, cheese stuffed pork katsu...maybe not authentic Korean, but damn, it was tasty! So much more to try...I need an aux stomach!  One quick note on ventilation: THEIRS WORKS QUITE WELL !!! (hint for the uninformed - it ducts under the table to common exhaust blowers, so no annoying overhead "periscopes" needed).  Thanks again Ian, and thanks GEN!  I will see you both again soon!

CdqgVkq4fUynRdqkEYNSFQ.text: This place is pretty awesome. We had to wait an hour for a table but it was well worth the wait!   My favorite are the Beef Bulgogi, the Korean Fried Chicken and the Hawaiian Steak but there are many other great options as well. Located in Tempe Marketplace this is a great date nights spot that is a one of a kind experience where you cook the food yourself Korean BBQ style!  Definitely one of my top choices when in Tempe and makes for a great night out on the town!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

l99Kgjzc_WJxHN0A_Nl6og.text: I went here tonight for a first date and it was absolutely amazing. I was served by an amazing server named Kim. He was very attentive and followed all the steps of service. There was not one time where I looked around and ask where is my server. He is the man. I highly recommend whenever you come here please ask for him and stress the importance because he's that great of a server.

Oa2HS4MdklFdRgpv4eGAkg.text: 2 Stars:  1 Star. For Food - the food was just not good and that's rather disappointing. I've been to the GEN in Rancho Cucamonga, CA & West Covina, CA which I absolutely love because the food is great and fresh. At this location that was not the case. Everything just tasted bland.   1 Star. For Customer Service - I don't even remember my servers name, all I know is that a majority of everyone who worked here was young and did not seem to enjoy their job. 3 different times did we have to ask someone else for a grill change and for someone to grab our check so that we were able to pay and leave.   For $60 + Tip, I was not satisfied at all and will not be returning.

PlEmobiEnJj8giqYzqRXjg.text: You walk in and immediately get greeted by the fog/smoke from the grills. Could use more ventilation.  AYCE that includes not only meat and seafood, but also some items cooked in the kitchen. Take note, you can only order 4 items at a time.   We ordered japchae, gyoza, and KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) from the kitchen, there were 6 of us, servings were small, each of us just had a bite of each item, the serving seemed to me, good for one person. So make sure to maybe triple up these items. We ordered their KFC a few times while we were there.   There was only a few banchan items - kimchi, pickled cucumber, pickled onions, edamame and mashed potato. I haven't seen mashed potato before as part of banchan. I've been to other KBBQ places that came with more banchan. No plain lettuce leaf, just lettuce salad.   We ordered a variety of meats including chicken and steak. Chicken and their steak are thicker cuts that will require longer cooking time. The rest are you typical thin sliced fast cooking meats. Personally the food was ok, even their Chadol (shaved beef brisket) was just ok. Chadol is one of my favorite meats for KBBQ, I wasn't feeling it that time.   In summary: good food, fun for groups, my favorite that night was their KFC. They do not take reservations. Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

JCEjQFErUhTQodau24JO1w.text: Korean BBQ is an experience.  Not a quick meal.  I had never been to a Korean BBQ before.  The wait here was 45 minutes.  Once seated, you have 2 hours to eat... all you can eat... but if you have left over food at your table when you check out, you will be charged extra.  The experience was cool, but we paid a lot of money to cook our own food at our table.  It wasn't anything special.  The ingredients weren't amazing.  The smoke in the restaurant from every table BBQing was intense and my eyes hurt.  Overall it was okay.  I certainly won't be returning because cooking my own food in a smoky room isn't really my bag... but it might be yours so give it a try.

40QiFSUgT-MSThaM9wP6Kw.text: Excellent place to go on a date or with family or a a friend you want to catch up with while enjoying great tasting healthy fresh food. Come hungry because you can eat as much as you want as long as you eat what you order otherwise there's charge.  It's clean and the staff are super attentive, friendly, and professional!  Can't say that compliment very much anymore these days!!   Try to get Ian, he's the best waiter there!!!!

0qwKKOEzvaQFYVx_XfJ6wA.text: Great service, friendly waitress. Awesome time.  Great place to chill and hang with friends #ap

Q2ZRRZXcPavjYZdmiHoW1Q.text: (Lyrics - The Who - My Generation)  People try to eat as many rounds (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) Just as fast as it comes around (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) Things they do look awfully g-g-good (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) I hope I'm full before I go (Yelping bout Gen-Korean)  This is Gen Korean  This is Gen Korean BBQ, baby  Why don't you all c-come this way (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) All-you-can-eat that makes us s-s-stay (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) I'm not trying to cause a big c-c-mmotion (Yelping bout Gen-Korean) I'm just Yelping bout G-G-Gen Korean (Yelping bout Gen-Korean)  Gen Korean This is Gen Korean BBQ, baby  Gen is a hot nightclub-like Korean BBQ spot.  Yes, night club indeed as music was blaring and at times deafening!  Needless to say, if I had kids this is probably not your jam.  As a single dude just hanging with friends; this would be your vibe.    Moreover, for $24.99 and 2 hours of AYCE, Gen does a relatively good job of that.  Their cuts of meats came quite quickly and service overall is fun and upbeat.  I would say they have more options than what I'm used to and also their cuts seem to have a bit more quality then most Korean BBQ joints around the valley.  Their grill is generally set at the right temperature and we didn't need to meddle with it much; they also changed it only once.  I think the down side for me is their bowl of rice.  I'm used to getting more moist and stickier rice in a silver covered bowl, but they served plain steam rice.    In the end, I think Gen has some great food and a 2 hour window is more than enough.  My only knock is probably not knowing if I should get up and dance or eat.  Service was great except that we didn't get our usual Korean side dishes to start as I gather they simply forgot ours tonight.  Prime cuts would be over exaggerated, but again better than most I've experienced. - Enjoy!

IOhnsNWe9tuqm5NCKa3nhg.text: This is my favorite place to get Korean bbq in the Phoenix area. Located in the Tempe marketplace (opposite the Barnes and noble), it offers a trendy ambience, centralized location, and fabulous food.  In addition to the usual list of bulbogi beef/pork, ribeye, pork belly and seafood, they also offer a "Korean fried chicken," which is essentially an extra crispy orange chicken. Absolutely delicious. There's  also a very spicy version of the fried chicken but that's not for the faint of heart. There are many Korean bbq places in Tempe/Mesa area, but this restaurant is a cut above the rest.

jHP-cph4auh2--Y9lc3oNg.text: Super pricey, but the food is amazing. 4 stars because of price and service is quite slow sometimes.  Cannot go wrong with their spicy pork belly, spicy pork bulgogi, garlic calamari, and mushroom and vegetables. I usually just order those four things over and over again until I'm full. And their rice is always perfect.

lchEpvSlEWbqBGNgZKKJ4w.text: Food was delicious! You order what you would like to make and it is already seasoned. They set up the little mini cook top for you and you just cook away. One thing we didn't like was that we can not take our cooked leftovers home and they charge you a fee for any left over food cooked or not.

PZr8BO-xWM-NzviEyaWtKA.text: Again, we are regulars! We had our bartender again, Blake! Always pleasant and attentive! Our favorite! We had a party of 10 today, pur time to eat was 7pm. We got there at 6pm to get on the list. It was a busy night so we didn't get seated until 7:45. Amanda, the supervisor/manager did her best to accommodate us ASAP! She was great and our server, Tomas was great and quick!! Another great experience at our favorite place!!

QgDhr6NdbUsGWegBLXH7qQ.text: Gen (which I presume is short for "Generally the best of all Korean BBQ Houses in the World") is my go-to KBBQ spot!    Reasonable prices, relatively quick service, a fine assortment of fresh meats and seafood, and all the accompaniments that should go along with the KBBQ meal!  AYCE KBBQ is really more of an experience than just a meal.  And it is wonderful for fun social gatherings with friends and family.  Conversation topics can include, among others, how you like your meat prepared... or how much meat you can fit in your mouth... which meat is your favorite... or how hot you like your meat when you put it in your mouth!    Lunch prices are about $17 per person... and dinner is around $25 per person.  For the amount of food that you get and the preparation that goes into slicing and marinating meats, I feel like it's a fair price provided that everyone is hungry and ready to eat.  As a chain restaurant, Gen has enough experience and processes in place to ensure that you're getting fresh ingredients, consistent service, and a similar experience each time.  I like that.    *****FIVE STARS****

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak, spicy pork bulgogi, and cajun shrimp!

lBeb5xkSPI6qzW5Vlcocsg.text: Have been here twice. Taste just like San Jose's. Nothing different from other Gens, unless you compare it to SoCal's Gen locations. Service was fine, sometimes a little slow with requests. However, every Korean BBQ place has their servers overworked, so it's just as expected. A big difference as compared to other location is that it's more crowded and always loud, probably because there's not a lot of KBBQ places around Tempe.

8y-m_ohnKPHrxg-RyXgSOg.text: Went here last weekend to try it out since it had great reviews. The wait was over an hour but so worth it! All you can eat and the food was to die for. Tried a lot on the menu and the atmosphere of the place was amazing. I will definitely come back here again!

50LFSd5AZD2hRMDxBasaAQ.text: My first experiences with Gen were at the socal locations, long lines and an overload of people made it an exercise is patience but the ambiance is electric and the food is exquisite! When we finally got our location here in Tempe i could not have been more excited! This location never disappoints. Same vibrant energy in the restaurant without the excessive lines/waiting of the socal locations.  You give the number of the party to the host, she seats you and the fun begins immediately. Korean BBQ involves cooking your own meats/poultry/seafood on a gas grill set into your table. A great menu allows you to choose traditional items such as bulgogi and beef tongue to more americanized items like KFC (Korean fried chicken) hahaha! Most traditional cuts are very thin and cook quickly, it takes very little time on the grill and of course we never want to over cook out meat!!! Make sure to order the salad and load up on that, its for aiding in digestion and also helps you be able to eat more meat! The setup here is all you can eat so get ready to load up on the best korean bbq quality meats in the valley, an impressive variety and a very fun place to enjoy good company and great times. I will continue to be a regular!

gBk9MyPNGXvkecn2z3qVMg.text: Not many choices in town for All You Can Eat Korean bbq, so GEN takes the top spot in my book for this category. Prices are great and quality of meat was much better than expected which keeps me coming back. Servers are always attentive, quick with orders and changing out the grill frequently.   Getting seated seems like a fiasco and always seems to take several minutes of standing at the front  desk after we are told a table is ready  but the place is always busy ... not a big issue and understandable.

560GHFsobdWf0jPSDegf8Q.text: Very friendly staff good quality food  I really like this place you going hungry you come out stuffed and the price doesn't change

_6BPSGEaHAs9nKtcqOP-kg.text: This Gen location is just okay. Coming from Southern California this place can use some work. The customer service was great, however they did take a while to retake my order and I constantly had to ask for my serve for little things like napkins.   I went during dinner time and it was not to crowded at all, which was part of why I think they need to up the customer service.  Overall a decent place out here to eat.

hPeExZ8V64tJ2q8RBvPi6w.text: Gen Rocks! So happy this is here in Arizona. Great food and staff and definitely my go to Kbbq spot.   They quickly get your food out. The only thing I recommend is somehow to make sure the floors aren't greasy like other kbbq places.

-VsG6zFpGjCZZSLaatm-xw.text: I'm not usually a fan of Korean bbq but my girlfriend insisted on going. All I have to say is WOW! Good was juicy, flavorful and fresh for a reasonable price. There was a pretty long wait but our server Phil made it worth while! Great service, great food. We will definitely be back.

ccuOSLNfBXMlnNmdb55M9g.text: I would usually give this joint a 5 star. But today was pretty jacked up. The Air conditioning in the establishment was broke, but I get it, it happens.  when our waitress chloe finally made her way to us, the experience started to go south. She started to forget everything we asked for. At first it was cute. She would forget, then she would have a cute reaction to her mistakes. But after the 4th or 5th time it was getting annoying. She would forget time and time again to the point that I was close to just leaving without bothering to pay. Even after all the times she would forget or jack up our order I would still say "thank you" and she wouldn't even reply with a "you're welcome", she would just roll her eyes and walk away. WHEN SOMEONE SAYS THANK YOU, REPLY WITH "YOURE WELCOME"!  I can go on about our experience tonight with our waitress chloe but my thumbs are starting to hurt just typing this and I'm short on time. But I will add this last part about our experience. She seemed pretty damn quick to give us the bill. We all know that feeling when someone places the bill in front of you that you kinda feel rushed, yeah,  not a cool feeling.   We plan to return to Gen but we will always make sure that we ask to not sit in Chloe's section.  Great food, great place, but bad experience today because of our server.

7tlhHflDcaydIXXHgDMQPg.text: I have gone to gen twice and the first time was amazing despite the two hour wait. After being seated, the waiter was amazing and we ate plenty of food despite not being offered bowls of rice.   The second time was during the week for my birthday and the service was horrible! The waiter barely came to the table and let our grill turn black and didn't even offer to change it. My friend had to ask another waiter to refill our waters despite the waiter walking past and forgetting about us. Worst experience and now I feel very indifferent about this restaurant.

Z7zlYf-wVRGO1euPCYHuWg.text: I went during on Monday afternoon, when it wasn't as busy, and our waiter Ly was very nice and attentive. He helped our table out when he noticed we weren't good at cooking the various selection of meats. The meat were seasoned well and I loved the green tea salt that helped add to the flavor of the meat. Loved the price, decor, and customer service. My experience here was better than the other Gen I ate at in San Jose. Would definitely come back once every month.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

oZaQO6QCmnRJQ0xeuV7OlA.text: My first time here and Danny was super friendly on top of everything his service was amazing thank you! Differently will be back soon

U8VxCT1YIiHHbegqy35fbg.text: My absolutely favorite KBQ I've ever had, and I use to live in Korean Town in Los Angeles! So good, service is always great. The wait is long, but well worth it. Brisket, short rib, and Tongue are favorites and the volcano chicken is a must try.

26RoJla9pODYRlsesASlpA.text: Let's me start of!!!! I'm a fan of Korean BBQ even I'm not Korean. This place food is great i go there 3-4 times a month. Service not too bad I could give 4.5 stars, except stupid rules that they should let their customers know or post some signs.  Just be prepare if you go there 1. Time limit "2 hours only" (Eat fast, pay me and get out).  2. You can not leftover food. Otherwise charge extra and sorry you can not pack food that you already pay extra.

NVKXvHo2m5N_oTNRJwpBEA.text: Pretty worth it! Went on a Tuesday and there was no wait. Portions are big so come hungry

4OGUvhFMua1uKnAnOKr-0w.text: I have no idea what is going on with Gen. They took rice paper off their menu and steamed egg. I ordered the tofu soup came in just a bowl so it was cold fast most places bring it in the stone bowl so it stays warm longer. I don't think it's worth the $24.99 not to have everything on the menu. The meat was not the best either.  I didn't like that the music they play was explicit being a family restaurant. I don't usually mind old school music but use clean version especially with little kids around. Servers were friendly I can't remember the name of the girl that we had but she was good. The only thing that sucked was we waited almost 15 min for our last plate we ordered. Probably won't be returning back to Gen in Az!

PFhzzh_qmhPtqVIwYXoEvQ.text: A very industrialized food chain! Why am I saying that? Smiles are not seen often at this location. With the amount of people in and out constantly, sometimes they forget to how to employ a good hospitality. My water never got refilled, my waitress works like a robot just come and go for the tasks of the day and nothing else, busboys would try to clean up quickly without asking if I was even finish with my food. Oh I get it! Because there is a line waiting outside and you wouldn't slip that chance of having extra money right? That was my last drawn! Okay, please take my unfinished food and rush me out of the door, oh and also I'm not coming back ever so it doesn't bother me! I will trust my instincts on trying other BBQ house located around Oriental Supermarkets.

hmg_0Y3B-k8C9cUVup7Ekg.text: I am SO GLAD this place finally opened up! I go to Gens all the time when I visit California, and it's about time they made their way to Arizona! The wait time was really long, but that was expected since they opened just a couple days ago. The food and service was great! All of the employees were friendly, and the meat came out so fast. We had no issues whatsoever. The only sad part was they had no alcohol. I was told that they will after their grand opening, though! I can't wait to go back again. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

PiKLHIBNVWj2Y2DRCQOybg.text: We liked the overall experience as there was a sort of grandeur to the place; the price, the interior, the food, the service. They obviously need improvements on the front desk part where they mix people with and without reservations into one line.. and they have 2 staffs!!   However as management went, we sat in the seats closest to the bathroom (under the projected movie screen) and there was this man doing Absolutely nothing but starring towards the customers (us) throughout the whole meal. I felt bad for the workers who were working their butts off for immediate service (yes everything went really quickly) and probably got paid less than this supervisor. We needed help a few times but who came to our aide? Not this guy. I would expect such a place to have an office to hide him in during busy hours.   Also and again related to management there was a review for someone who's burnt pots got cleaned, no question asked? We had a woman in heels and pencil skirt who came by and scolded us on burning the pot--she did not seem happy but bitter as the burnt pot. I know we look Korean but that doesn't mean we know how to use the pot and not burn the food without the waiters teaching us. I dont think its our responsibility to fix the stove temperature especially as a beginner but apparently it was set too high and she fixed it as she warned us. Thank you but No thank you!!

NQZCQ_pilSDOYIMflPWNKA.text: I had great time here with my girls. I like their pork belly, steak, bulgogi and Jap Chae. But the service was kinda slow because the restaurant was crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

9Hbeudqvtu4jbci1llAEAQ.text: I Love this place, came in for lunch and had Brandi... thanks for keeping the food coming and being so attentive! We will be coming back to see you at lunch again!

q4FSxnMzCvO9OhmNcKUbeA.text: Visited for the first time last weekend - absolutely loved it! In fact I haven't stopped daydreaming about it since... seriously one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Can't wait to go back! Spicy pork bulgogi and Cajun pork belly were so good I almost cried  Good service - the manager came by the table to check on us, which was a nice touch.

tka0DqlDENdkc4oOJYPd7A.text: Omg! Came here on a 3/22 for my niece's bday. It was our first time and it was more than what I expected. Food was fresh (hahah) everyone was very nice and helpful. Our waiter Derric answered all of our questions and we had a million and not once did he seem annoyed!! I will be back for sure. It was worth every penny I spent in there!! I can't wait to bring hubby here for date night!!

POjSmzrDMdDlXR4WiApKvw.text: We love Korean bbq. I would recommend Gen to people if they would like good Korean BBQ. It's definitely not a mom and pop restaurant but it is a good time and the ambiance is nice.  I ordered a mango Capri Soju with lunch and it was delicious and generously sized. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

a97PKiv8Wuy-prhWbmc3wg.text: Went back a second time for lunch option. There was no wait so little to no  interaction with the host. Once we were seated service was terrible. It took long to bring our food out, I understand that there is probably a pace for the food to be sent out because it's "all you can eat" however we order maybe 4 items at a time with 3 people at the table that's reasonable if you ask me. I asked for more potatoes and kim chi radish 2 times during a 30 min time frame. I didn't receive it until I asked a 3 rd time and even then it was an additional 5 minute wait.   Not sure that I will return.

1KVNiQfkJ3FuiEcWoLKuxQ.text: Another great dinner and tip notch service best kbbq in town. David S was an awesome server

ZqBudY-yVCM-fwq2l5iB7A.text: The novelty of this place may be the coolest part about it, for the price and what you get it's a major win as well.  I came in for lunch while I was waiting for my car that was getting serviced down the road, as I walk in the hostess very loudly announces "party of one!" The entire staff then shouts "welcome to Gen". Okay this is corny as all hell and it was the only annoying part about this place.  To the good stuff now. This place is straight forward, 16.99 all you can eat up to two hours during lunch and if you have any leftovers you have to pay a $5 penalty. Not bad.  I started it off with a "premium" steak, which is essentially a top sirloin, I also got pork belly, beef bulgogi, gyoza and a side of rice. I literally had to muscle through at the end but this stuff was not only good but worth the price of admission. This is a cool spot to go with a small group because the inherent interactive nature of Korean BBQ. The service is top notch as well. Gen is a winner, even if it's a chain.  My advice though: stop with the "welcome to Gen".

QvC53wZhUVo8I3Xeyb1JPg.text: Really liked the concept here. You pay 24.99 and can eat unlimited meat for 2 hours and your food comes with a salad (so good) and white rice and some stuff to mix your meats with. You get 4 options at a time. I enjoyed some more than others but I liked the place it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

S9VmdVmnxNmBM1bBinCW7g.text: I really appreciated how the server Phillip went out of his way to help me and my friends even though we were not his section. Having a large party teamwork matters and him and M.J. Served us excellently. Most definitely coming back for excellent food & service!

S9RBSqynzRgyZwknD0fnFw.text: If you looking for inexpensive placre to have a new experience and/or this is your 1st time at a Korean BBQ joint. Then I encourage you to try this place out immediately.   There is almost always a wait time however  They get you in as quickly as possible.  Be prepared to cook your own food as this is not like the habachi stands what I do it for you. I would stay away from the wine as it's cheap and hot. The Mai Tais are life!!! For the True heat seekers, I would get the Volcano Chicken but ask for the sauce on the side! Always order the Galbi beef and the bulgogi.... The shrimp is blandly season.... Unless you're like me and order the cajun shrimp but cook it with the volcano shrimp ( wait.... did I just create something ) !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hey now Mai Tai
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

PSgyGYvdx-hacQ63R_LusA.text: $24.99/person for "all you can eat" but you have only 2 hours and your table can only order 4 dishes at a time. Each dish has a big enough-ish serving for 2 people but if you're going in a group of more than 4 people then I suggest splitting into separate tables so everyone can order at least one dish that they want each time.  Service is fast and friendly. It's a nice place for a special Occassion but honestly, with 5 people that's a total of $125 (without drinks) and you could have a bbq at home.  So the service is a 5, food is 4 stars but value is 2 stars.

u26xEyKWFVZx_ZNO7p_Dkw.text: Love the food and the atmosphere a fun area but damn the people up front and around are super rude the woman who brought our actual food was an angel but the other would glare one rolled her eyes, like y'all I get it working sucks but damn at least fake it, overall I had fun with friends for my birthday so I guess that's all that matters.

eKNj-zScBA30kCWt69krOQ.text: My friends and I always went to Gen's whenever we happen to be in Vegas. It was a must on our to-do list. Now that there's one in AZ, we knew that we HAD to come here.   It was around 5:45pm and surprisingly there was no wait. We got seated right away. It took quiet a while for us to be approached by our waitress. You would imagine that for being seated right away, someone would take our drink order (at least) at a decent time. Throughout the night, the service continued to be slow.   Aside from the slow service, the food never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

_PCD9Ce-CmxYDAVTY0H1aw.text: All of the servers are amazing here but especially LUNA. She's incredibly sweet, funny, and attentive. She came to check up on us frequently which is important at an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ place so we can maximize our orders within the 2-hour limit. She gave us recommendations on what to order since their menu is expansive. We had a grill change once, but upon request, we got it changed as many times as needed.   Of all the AYCE BBQ joints in AZ, this is by far my favorite when it comes to quality of service, food, and ambiance. Luna made our night enjoyable and I'd definitely go back!

YNz-P7NauvgNfecdRSKt2A.text: I've been twice now, and enjoyed both visits for the food. The meat is very high-quality as others have mentioned. However, I can't get enough of thei particular squid and octopus. Rather than juvenile or mature specimens, they bring out these succulent little babies good for 2-3 bites each. They cook fast, and go down oh so nice! Mid-week lunch is the super value for about $16, but yes there is no doubt dinner price is still worth it, plus you get several more options. I think all of the ban-chan provided to me were also quite tasty. Make sure you ask for the radish wraps. Those are larges slices to wrap around your meats for added cooling, and crunch.   Atmosphere? Well, think of a singles bar with overhead videos, open ,airy, and somewhat boisterous. Definitely a millenial-bias to the crowd, LOL.

j_k7V9BDIe_mvNHjhZ81mg.text: Per other yelpers suggestion, we came slightly earlier for dinner so we wouldn't have to wait long for a table. And I'm glad we did. We arrived a little after 5 and only waited for 20 minutes.  We were seated at a booth with a grill in the middle, sides were already set, waiting for us. The sides included pickled radish, potato salad, pickled cucumber (no, not pickles), Cole slaw, kimchi, edamame, and pickled onions. There's also seasoning dishes already served as well. Our server promptly came to take our order - we were not ready for that yet, but ordered drinks. Also found out you can order unlimited sides which includes salad and rice.  He returned and explained its all you can eat in a 2 hour time frame, you can select up to 4 meats, they bring it to your table, and cook it on the grill. We ordered garlic calamari, the #7 special of marinated sliced beef, beef sorry ribs, and Cajun shrimp. I wasn't very fond of the calamari but both the beef dishes and shrimp were delicious. Our next round consisted of garlic chicken, Hawaiian chicken, sliced beef brisket, and flat iron steak. Beef seems the way to go. Just wasn't feeling the chicken - altho the garlic chicken had an awesome jalapeno fondue sauce that accompanied.  We got a third round of meats and called it good. Very satisfied and happy. The service was superb. They come by to clean plates off and bring fresh grills after you've used it for each round.  My hubby is a body builder and he ate like a champ - hard to believe 2 hours isn't enough time to stuff your face unless you're completely overdoing it.  Fun atmosphere, great service, and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. I was caught yelping!!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Just grilling at our table.
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. First round of proteins: order 4 at a time. Garlic calamari, beef short rib, Cajun shrimp, and beef bulobi (sp.)... #7

TryLKDOq0SJZtzVVTZ5SqA.text: Had a great time here. All you can eat Korean BBQ....yes please. Look if you need more than two hours to stuff your face you either didn't eat fast enough or are the biggest glutton ever. 2 hours for all you can eat is not only insane it's also amazing. Hahahaha.   I stumbled upon this place as I live in more of the north valley. I liked the vibe, ambience, and the food was good. Our server David S. was on point. One because we have the same name but he was totally cool and also took great care of us. Definitely 5 stars for him all day long.  The meats were good. I have had all you can eat and this was better than the other place up in north Scottsdale.   For two people we got 10 items and we were stuffed. The bulgogi is necessary always and you have to just try it anywhere they serve it. The steak was good. Gyoza was also tasty. Oh the KFC and Volcano Chicken were amazing. The Volcano chicken was spicy but perfect for me. Great great flavor but do not get it if you don't like spice. Flat iron steak was thinly sliced and you have to cook it in the middle. Galbi was also tasty. The Hawaiian steak was also good and they have a nice piece of pineapple to go with it.   They also had unfiltered sake. Yaaaaaa!!!  Only thing is I wish the condiment sides were a tad better tasting and more variety but they were still good.   Again, David S was awesome and everything came out quick and there was plenty of food. Will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. It&#39;s lit
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. More flat iron
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

FIiv-SYwx3CIsqGRidVskw.text: This is a family favorite. My brothers, cousins, and I have gone here a lot and we've even been bringing our own seasonings. It's also a fun experience to be the chef who is cooking and then you can eat it while it's still hot. You can cook it to your liking and we like to season the meat with the salts and dipping seasonings. It's a popular place and it's good for lunch and dinner and for the family. We're always looking for new places to eat, but this is always a choice when we're looking for a place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

IZakp6h1s5IrLxSyrYLU7g.text: Unlimited sides. Amazing service. Delicious meat. They get the food out pretty fast in less than 5 minutes. Perfect for a big group of people as well. 10 out of 10 recommend!! Also, ask for the server Brandi, she is kind and full of energy. She made sure I was comfortable and checked in periodically. She also knows the menu very well.

nEfpJ_Kp14rlIb02-Yk2xA.text: I have to be honest although this was an amazing experience the service was awful! We waited for about an hour before finally receiving our food it was ridiculous! Oh and that green tea salt is the most delicious thing on all of the meats!

hD3i_XXcbxhWExEFXIFZng.text: Everything here is delicious!  We finally decided to visit this restaurant and we have no doubts about coming back soon.  4 dishes at a time on a 2 hour window. Come on! Who can be disappointed? We didn't had enough stomach space to tried all 36 items on the menu, but what we order was on point, the consistency of the food flavors are unforgettable and delicious.  The customer service here it's decent overall.  We had the pleasure to meet one of their managers on site Mr. Giovanni he was always attentive to everyone while we were there, walking around from table to table making sure the experience was great for everyone.  From our perspective we HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to everyone!!!!   Tip-Make sure you don't eat anything before you go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Love Korean Food
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Make sure you choose wisely.

asNmcjUniYNgkuobXyIB1A.text: We love Korean bbq, but not this place.  Very Smokey, no overhead vents, clouds of smoke!  Low Quality Meat!  $25 per person minimum, low quality and few options.  Club Atmosphere, loud music, young staff.   Expensive but Not fine dining.

DGXuIlEQWxviKs_hQ7WMMw.text: Yummmy!!! Loving this all you can eat Korean bbq spot!! It's no secret this spot is popular, there is usually a long wait especially on weekends! For example we waited an hr and 15 for a table of 3! The good thing is that it is located in Tempe market place so there are a ton of shopping spots and bars around to keep you occupied while waiting! Another big thing to know is that if you do not check back in within ten minutes after your table is ready, they will give away your table!   A few of my favorites: Beef bulgogi Top Sirloin steak  Beef brisket  KFC - comes cooked  Hawaiian chicken (takes long to cook)     I also tried the chicken gyoza, personally I felt it was dry but hey it's all you can eat so why not try it hehe:)   Service was great and bathrooms were clean, just be prepared to do some cooking and enjoy:)

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beef bulgogi and top sirloin steak
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad and rice plus seasonings

NgAQpp0Q7HsTTmVUMFc-sA.text: Just say when and I'll see you at Gen!  I've been to many Gen locations and KBBQ's in LA, Vegas, and now phx. KBBQ has made a boom over the past year in the East Valley and of the pickings Gen is one of the top fighters.  The service is fantastic! Very kind, and always making sure that you are happy. If it's your first time they describe the rules clearly and I've noticed depending on the staff and time they can flex on the rules a bit.  The ambiance is a bit clubby with lighting that is dark, and loud music but this is minor for me as the food is what I'm vibing with.  On the menu, they have lots of options for proteins, veggies, and kitchen items. Order 4 at a time and as soon as they come back order your next set to minimize your wait time. If you're hungry shoot for the thin quick cook meats or kitchen items.   My favorites are the premium steak, flat iron, wine pork belly, jap chae, and volcano chicken (the heat builds up pretty quickly on this!)  The drinks, other than water are not included in the ayce. The water used to taste really interesting but has since improved. I've ordered hot tea a few times and half the time it is luke warm.  Only gripes are that I wish rice paper was available and banchan sizes were larger so I wouldn't have to ask for refills so often :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Corn cheese now available
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy hour anyone?
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. The thinnest L.A. galbi I&#39;ve seen...

JuOF2-ZfAvXprTAUJ3mUeg.text: Everything was so exceptional! It's difficult to explain WHY the thinly sliced steak, chicken pieces and vegetables (mushrooms, sweet red bell peppers, even regular onion slices) tasted so outstanding. It's obviously because the meat is seasoned and marinated wonderfully, the vegetables take on the flavor of the meat's juices, and the grill is "magical". Haha  You can see in the photos and my video that the round "grill" is recessed into the middle of the table, and there's rarely any flames. I'm not sure if many people know this, but you can adjust the temperature on the end of the table. (See the photo of the knob.) I recommend the hottest setting. The best tip that I have for you is to keep in mind (when ordering) that the chicken pieces take longer to cook that the thin steak slices, so you want to get them cooking while you enjoy (and I mean be amazed) by the steak. It's wagu tender and so flavorful, yet you do have 3 dipping dishes in front of you, if you'd like to lightly dab into a special soy sauce, regular salt and pepper blend or special salt.   There are meat scissors to cut the raw meat into your desired "bite size" pieces, and everything's eaten with chopsticks, even salad and slaw, but you've got this.  It was sort of strange that all of the tables were set with the tiny sides already out on the table, like slaw, as I just walked past, but it was nice to have the edamame already there. The slaw is the mayo-type & was great to cool down my tongue after a spicy bite. You can get as many refills of any of these too.  The price is amazing! For $25, you can eat to your heart's and stomach's content for 2 hours!   Some people turn down the salad, rice and skip the sides figuring that they'd rather "get their money's worth" on the meat, but I suggest to say yes and have them there on the table even if you just want a nibble. It doesn't count for your "4 dishes at a time." And the salad (dressing) was great!  You can only order 4 entrees at a time, but you can order the next four as soon as you can grab your server again. The servers and all of staff are very friendly.

pL34Iqy0CtdO_Y0I2wdaQw.text: I'm OBSESSED with this place! There is a large SELECTION and CUT of meats that's you'll have to come in more than once to truly experience all the flavors! You are seated in booths with a hot grill just waiting to be used (the knob is on the front of the table where you can adjust the heat setting). Already waiting are several little dishes that are used to add FLAVOR and SEASONING to keep everything rich!   We ordered SO MUCH food (all you can eat for $25 per person? Yes please!). The CHICKEN was one of our favorites and so was the FLAT IRON STEAK! You also get served a bowl of rice and salad to go with all the protein! It was A LOT of fun being able to grill especially because you can cook it to how you like it!   The vents are amazing too, it keeps the place from becoming too smoky! The staff was so friendly and attentive! We went for a birthday dinner but I think this place is great for ALL OCCASIONS!   If I could describe Gen in one sentence it would be: your meat, your way!  I'm definitely going to be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Pork Belly, Flat Iron Steak, Salad, and Rice!
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Pork Belly and Flat Iron Steak

zSUU6Fr3MXyM1MIUGdYsTQ.text: Visiting in from the East coast and found this awesome spot in Tempe. Getting a high top wasn't an issue and we got seated right away. The staff is lightening fast and gets you going right away. The grill is not charcoal which is probably the only downside to the whole experience but the food comes out delicious anyways. Warning, you will leave smelling like food. But you can't beat this experience.   The menu has a long list of all you can eat items for $24.99. To me this is absurd, but in a great way. You can only order four items at a time. You want your brain to catch up to your stomach as you shove food into your mouth all night. We had the short ribs, pineapple pork, top beef sirloin. Along with a fried chicken dish from the chicken (tasted like orange chicken)    My friend ordered a bunch of items since he's been here before. The food was amazing and I honestly didn't have one bad item. Our server was friendly and amazing. No doggie bags here, so eat what you can but don't waste food or else you will be charged. There is a two hour time limit per sitting. Overall, dinner for two with a bottle of cold unfiltered sake was $80 with the tip. You can't touch that price where I'm from.   I will be back soon when I'm in the area. Keep up the good work.   "My review is strictly my opinion based on my experience and interaction with the business and/or persons while they provided me a service, food, or merchandise. This review is not to be translated as fact. My review is truthful to the best of my ability and is not intended to present harm to the business but to encourage them to perform better or allow them to continue being awesome. I have not received any monetary gain for writing this review" - Bruno F

Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Short rib
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Korean BBQ

E0aPFAlz2fbnjlfgCFxbpg.text: Gen Korean BBQ House is located inside Tempe Marketplace.  It is always busy, so wither make a reservation, or be prepared for a short wait.  The restaurant is clean, and not overly smoky, despite the number of grills going.  There is nothing special about the BBQ part.  It is on par with others, and runs on the more expensive end as far as price.  There are many selections on the menu, including your standard bulgogis.  I found that when you order the vegetables, you get hardly anything, and it is mostly devil apples (onions), which you all know that I abhor.  A few mushrooms, and not too much else.  The meat is plentiful, with lots of runners throughout the business.  This is good, because you don't have a long wait if your server is busy.  I will add, however, that our beverages were only refilled once, after waiting what seemed like forever.  When you had a salt-dehydrated mouth, waiting for a refill, and then never getting another one, is awful.  Overall, Gen is a great place for Korean BBQ, especially as a means of introducing it to folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States. Too much sake!

-55PEGEJyJ8OLnwqDcwjAQ.text: Had a fun tasty collaborative group interactive meal on a Sunday afternoon , no wait but big busy restaurant. The food was plentiful and our lead server bueller sp? As in the great movie ( Farris) lived up to his character great service backed by a busy team bringing a variety of meats and more to grill on the table. All was good , unique , interesting , tofu soup , chicken , veggies , unique green tea salt and more , fun day Sunday . FYI couldn't check in as internet in " the district" mall poor I was told , many big cement walls that aside ( leave phone aside ) and have fun st Gen, bring your friends and of family .

_dNsmWvg4mLt0fdML_QkNA.text: My friend introduced me to this place. I did not know what kind of restaurant she chose and I wanted to be surprised by the menu. Little did I know what I was in for!   There was a little wait but once we got in, we were seated at a table with a grill in the middle! The waitor, who was super helpful and personable, walked us through the experience. We were informed that it was a buffet like set up with a limit of about 5 items at a time.   I loved the whole experience! I tried a range of different items and was impressed by the flavor in what was brought to our table.  All in all, I highly recommend going, at least for the experience. It can be a bit pricey so if you want the experience without the big price tag, try going for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gen Korean BBQ House - Tempe, AZ, United States

AcsRzOunRtEmcZZxCSmHLg.text: This place was cool for a couples date night but I have mixed reviews.    Pros: Fresh & Tasty food.  I especially loved the sides.  The overall experience of cooking your own food was entertaining.  All you can eat meat! Can't beat that. Location is perfect because there normally a long wait so we have plenty of options to grab drinks, shop or people watch before dinner.  Great menu!   Cons: The service was just ok. Our hostess and waiters honestly didn't seem happy to be at work.  Not a great place if you don't eat a lot like me & my husband.  Very smoky and caused us a lot of coughing. Noticed this happens when grills need to be changed.  $5 a plate rule is strange for uncooked food.... Especially since you can't take any doggy bags  I would take someone again just for the experience but this place e isn't going on my must-go/regulars list.
